meanings.definition: A shallow drinking cup with two handles, typically made of wood and used in Scotland.
meanings.sent1: During the Scottish festival, the guests passed around the quaiches filled with traditional whisky.
meanings.sent2: The shop displayed a variety of beautifully crafted quaiches for sale.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone had a good laugh when they tried to drink from the quaiches without spilling.
meanings.sent4: The quaiches on the table gleamed in the candlelight, inviting guests to share a toast.
meanings.sent5: The sound of quaiches clinking together echoed through the room as the friends raised them in a toast.

meanings.definition: The plural form of 'quaich', referring to multiple shallow drinking cups with two handles.
meanings.sent1: The hostess brought out a set of quaiches to serve drinks to all the guests.
meanings.sent2: The collection of quaiches on the shelf caught the eye of the antique collector.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the quaiches were magical goblets, sipping imaginary potions from them.
meanings.sent4: In the museum, the display case held ancient quaiches once used by Scottish clans.
meanings.sent5: The quaiches lined up neatly on the tray looked like a row of miniature boats ready to set sail.
